Description: THIS GRANT IS FOR OVERSIGHT AND MONITORING OF THE ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE OAK RIDGE RESERVATION.  NO REGULATORY ACTIVITIES MAY BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS AWARD.

THE WORLD INSTITUTE FOR NUCLEAR SECURITY (WELTWEITES INSTITUT FÜR NUKLEARE SICHERHEIT, KUR)
THE PURPOSE OF THIS EFFORT IS TO ENGAGE NUCLEAR AND RADIOLOGICAL SECURITY PROFESSIONALS IN SHARING AND PROMOTING 
GOOD PRACTICES THAT WILL ENHANCE NUCLEAR AND RADIOLOGICAL SECURITY PROGRAMS; IMPROVE THE SUSTAINABILITY OF NUCLEAR 
SECURITY IN RELATION TO NUCLEAR AND OTHER RADIOACTIVE MATERIALS, FACILITIES AND ASSOCIATED ACTIVITIES; COUNTER NUCLEAR 
SMUGGLING; AND, COUNTER THREATS AND THEREFORE REDUCE THE RISK OF NUCLEAR AND RADIOLOGICAL TERRORISM.

LOW LEVEL RADIOACTIVE WASTE FORUM (LLWF), INC. 
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO EXPLORE VIABLE SOURCE MANAGEMENT AND DISPOSAL OPTIONS OF LOW-LEVEL RADIOACTIVE 
WASTE IN THE INTEREST OF NATIONAL SECURITY.

PORTSMOUTH PUBLIC OUTREACH SUPPORT GRANT

ERIS WILL PROVIDE LEADERSHIP AND COORDINATION FOR ESTABLISHING MULTI-STATE, INTERSTATE PARTICIPATION IN ITRC PROJECTS USING THEIR EXISTING EXTENSIVE NETWORK WITH MEMBER STATES. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED, IN PART, BY ESTABLISHING GRANTS WITH THOSE STATES REQUESTED BY THE ITRC LEADERSHIP TEAM, BY PROVIDING A FULL-TIME ITRC PROJECT MANAGER, BY SOLICITING THE SERVICES OF SUPPORT CONTRACTORS, AND BY COORDINATING TRAINING COURSES, WORKSHOPS, AND NATIONAL MEETINGS.

COMMUNITY & REGULATORY FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO SCIOTO VALLEY: PIKETON AREA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (COG), HOST OF PORTSMOUTH GASEOUS DIFFUSION PLANT LOCATED ON A 3,777-ACRES OF FEDERALLY-OWNED LAND. THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS FOR EDUCATION, MONITORING AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE. THE FACILITY WAS ONE OF THREE LARGEST GASEOUS DIFFUSION PLANTS IN THE UNITED STATES INITIALLY CONSTRUCTED TO PRODUCE ENRICHED URANIUM TO SUPPORT THE NATION’S NUCLEAR WEAPONS PROGRAM AND EVENTUALLY USED BY COMMERCIAL NUCLEAR REACTORS.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO THE FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED SYBCI TRIBE TO STUDY AND DEVELOPMENT OF EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS DOCUMENTING THE CULTURAL SIGNIFICANCE OF THE BURRO FLATS PORTION OF THE SSFL AND HOW THE PAST, CURRENT, AND FUTURE ACTIVITIES HAVE AFFECTED AND CAN HELP PRESERVE THE SITE. THE AWARD WILL SUPPORT THE RECIPIENT IN RESEARCHING HISTORICAL DOCUMENTS AND INFORMATION; ANALYZING HOW PAST, CURRENT, AND PROPOSED FUTURE ACTIVITIES MAY AFFECT THE CULTURAL HERITAGE AND ARTIFACTS ON THE SITE; DEVELOPING COMMUNICATION AND EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS TO HELP REINFORCE AND SUPPORT CULTURAL TIES TO THE SITE; AND OUTREACH TO HELP AMPLIFY THE MESSAGES DEVELOPED IN THE AWARD.

UNDER THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AWARD, THE RECIPIENT SHALL EXPAND ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING TO INCLUDE CROPS, ASSOCIATED SOILS IN NEW LOCATIONS, CULTURAL RESOURCES, UPDATING CURRENT MONITORING AND SAMPLING PLANS, AND SUPPORTING RISK ASSESSMENT EFFORTS MADE IN RECENT YEARS, WHILE BUILDING ON THE PROGRESS DURING PREVIOUS YEARS.

THE PUEBLO DE SAN ILDEFONOSO WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE NATURAL RESOURCE DAMAGE ASSESSMENT (NRDA) TRUSTEE COUNCIL AND FOCUS ON ACTIVITIES INVOLVING PROTECTING THE HEALTH OF THE RESIDENTS AND THE ENVIRONMENT OF THE PUEBLO.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO AID THE PUEBLO OF SANTA CLARA IN CONDUCTING A BROAD ASSESSMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL, ECOLOGICAL, AND HUMAN HEALTH CONDITIONS ON PUEBLO LAND. THESE ASSESSMENTS WILL ALLOW THE PUEBLO TO IDENTIFY ISSUES OF CONCERN, AND THEN DETERMINE THE EXTENT THAT THOSE ISSUES WILL IMPACT AND COMPROMISE THE MANNER BY WHICH THE PUEBLO COMMUNITY ENGAGES IN ITS TRADITIONAL USE OF THE COMMUNITY NATURAL RESOURCES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO:
1) ESTABLISH A NEW GRANT FOR THE PERIOD OF FOUR AND A HALF YEARS (FEBRUARY 6, 2020 THROUGH JUNE 30, 2024). 

2) APPROVE THE BUDGET FOR THE PERIOD (FEBRUARY 6, 2020 TO JUNE 30, 2020).

3) OBLIGATE INCREMENTAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $129,733.00 TO SUPPORT SOUTH CAROLINA EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT DIVISION ACTIVITIES.

AN ANNUAL PROPOSED BUDGET SHALL BE SUBMITTED TO THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY (WITH EACH CONTINUING APPLICATION) FOR APPROVAL PRIOR TO ANY EXPENDITURES FOR EACH OF THE FOLLOW-ON YEARS.

THE FOLLOWING ATTACHMENTS ARE INCORPORATED: PART I -BUDGET, PART II - PROJECT DESCRIPTION AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS, AND PART III - SPECIAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

AS A RESULT OF THIS AWARD, THE OBLIGATED DOLLARS OF THIS GRANT ARE 129,733.00.

THE TOTAL ESTIMATED COST OF THIS GRANT IS $1,571,669.  THIS IS NOT A PROMISE TO AWARD NOR AN AUTHORIZATION TO EXPEND FUNDS IN THIS AMOUNT.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO:

1) ESTABLISH A NEW FIVE-YEAR GRANT FOR THE PERIOD OCTOBER 1, 2018 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 30, 2023 TO CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN AND ENHANCE EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AT THE SAVANNAH RIVER SITE.

2) APPROVE THE BUDGET FOR FISCAL YEAR 2019 IN THE AMOUNT OF $191,414.00 AND OBLIGATE INCREMENTAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $191,414.00.  AN ANNUAL PROPOSED BUDGET SHALL BE SUBMITTED TO THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY (WITH EACH CONTINUING APPLICATION)FOR APPROVAL PRIOR TO ANY EXPENDITURE FOR EACH OF THE FOLLOW-ON YEARS.

THE FOLLOWING ATTACHMENTS ARE INCORPORATED:  PART I - BUDGET, PART II - PROJECT DESCRIPTION AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS, AND PART III - SPECIAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

THE TOTAL ESTIMATED COST OF THIS GRANT IS $980,192.80.  THIS IS NOT A PROMISE TO AWARD NOR AN AUTHORIZATION TO EXPEND THE FUNDS IN THIS AMOUNT.
